page.title: 03A DAIRY FARM NEAR KIRKCOWAN
page.content: Mr Gemmell owns {Holm Farm }on the outskirts of the village.The name comes from a Danish word meaning a meadow by the river.He has{200 acres} of land and {56 Friesians.}They produce 800 litres of milk which is stored in a bulk tank and removed to the creamery in Stranraer.His stock are fed on cake,silage and hay which he grows on his farm.Work on the farm is done by members of his family.Milking is done twice a day about 6.30am and 5pm.He breds his own stock which are kept{inside}in{Winter} and let{out}in the{Summer.}There are 3 houses for his family on the farm.The farm is owned by his father.He has seen more{machinery}being used and{ {fewer people}being employed.
